content: wendel copyright © general hogbuffer 2013 i have found the basis for this design in one of my stitch dictionaries it is called wendeltreppe i e spiral staircase because of the way it shifts by one stitch after each repeat this has a subtle effect on the leg with the lace slowly spiralling around to the ankle and over the instep since this design started out as my contribution to the october ska challenge which was mirrored designs i have provided 2 versions twisting either way but there is nothing to say you couldn t work both socks the same size i have only given instructions for one size working with a 12 stitch repeat and using 72 sts all around the leg however because the pattern has quite a bit of give in it this will fit a wider range of people the foot can then be further adjusted to fit exactly material precise amounts of yarn will always depend on the length of the leg and the size of the foot but broadly speaking you should be ok with around 100 gr / 400 mtrs of sock yarn 4 ply / fingering weight i would go for a solid or a semi-solid colour the design is strong enough to be visible with slight variegation but a multi coloured yarn will probably obscure the pattern needle size 2 5 mm or size needed to get the right dimensions this design can equally be knit on circulars or dpn s use what you are most comfortable with and what works best for you i have worked with a guage of 8 sts / inch but you could play with the needle size if you need to adjust the size of the sock further requirements tapestry needle stitch markers although you could do it without if they irritate you wendel page 2 cuff using your cast on method of choice cast on 80 sts close to a round taking care not to twist the sts rib k2 p2 to end work in 2x2 rib for as long as you prefer my sample has 24 rounds k one round decreasing 8 sts equally spaced if you prefer you could start from the beginning with 72 sts but i find i prefer to have a bit more room at the ankle leg this is where you have to decide if you want to work version a or version b if you want to work symmetrical socks work one each if you are not worried about symmetry i would suggest you work both socks in version a as i found the decreases in version b more of a struggle but see what you prefer version a work the 8 row of chart a working the design 6 times around the leg this is one repeat when you come to start the second repeat round 9 and at the first round of all future repeats you will need to shift the last st you worked
